segment.source: Planning for Using App-V with Office
segment.target: Planning for Using App-V with Office

segment.source: Planning for Using App-V with Office
segment.target: Planning for Using App-V with Office

segment.source: Planning for Using App-V with Office
segment.target: Planning for Using App-V with Office

segment.source: Use the following information to plan how to deploy Office by using Microsoft Application Virtualization (App-V) 5.1.
segment.target: Use the following information to plan how to deploy Office by using Microsoft Application Virtualization (App-V) 5.1.

segment.source: Planning for using App-V with coexisting versions of Office
segment.target: Planning for using App-V with coexisting versions of Office

segment.source: How Office integrates with Windows when you deploy use App-V to deploy Office
segment.target: How Office integrates with Windows when you deploy use App-V to deploy Office

segment.source: You can use the App-V 5.1 Sequencer to create plug-in packages for Language Packs, Language Interface Packs, Proofing Tools and ScreenTip Languages.
segment.target: You can use the App-V 5.1 Sequencer to create plug-in packages for Language Packs, Language Interface Packs, Proofing Tools and ScreenTip Languages.

segment.source: You can then include the plug-in packages in a Connection Group, along with the Office 2013 package that you create by using the Office Deployment Toolkit.
segment.target: You can then include the plug-in packages in a Connection Group, along with the Office 2013 package that you create by using the Office Deployment Toolkit.

segment.source: The Office applications and the plug-in Language Packs interact seamlessly in the same connection group, just like any other packages that are grouped together in a connection group.
segment.target: The Office applications and the plug-in Language Packs interact seamlessly in the same connection group, just like any other packages that are grouped together in a connection group.

segment.source: Microsoft Visio and Microsoft Project do not provide support for the Thai Language Pack.
segment.target: Microsoft Visio and Microsoft Project do not provide support for the Thai Language Pack.

segment.source: The following table lists the versions of Microsoft Office that App-V supports, methods of Office package creation, supported licensing, and supported deployments.
segment.target: The following table lists the versions of Microsoft Office that App-V supports, methods of Office package creation, supported licensing, and supported deployments.

segment.source: Planning for using App-V with coexisting versions of Office
segment.target: Planning for using App-V with coexisting versions of Office

segment.source: You can install more than one version of Microsoft Office side by side on the same computer by using “Microsoft Office coexistence.”
segment.target: You can install more than one version of Microsoft Office side by side on the same computer by using “Microsoft Office coexistence.”

segment.source: You can implement Office coexistence with combinations of all major versions of Office and with installation methods, as applicable, by using the Windows Installer-based (MSi) version of Office, Click-to-Run, and App-V 5.1.
segment.target: You can implement Office coexistence with combinations of all major versions of Office and with installation methods, as applicable, by using the Windows Installer-based (MSi) version of Office, Click-to-Run, and App-V 5.1.

segment.source: However, using Office coexistence is not recommended by Microsoft.
segment.target: However, using Office coexistence is not recommended by Microsoft.

segment.source: Microsoft’s recommended best practice is to avoid Office coexistence completely to prevent compatibility issues.
segment.target: Microsoft’s recommended best practice is to avoid Office coexistence completely to prevent compatibility issues.

segment.source: However, when you are migrating to a newer version of Office, issues occasionally arise that can’t be resolved immediately, so you can temporarily implement coexistence to help facilitate a faster migration to the latest product version.
segment.target: However, when you are migrating to a newer version of Office, issues occasionally arise that can’t be resolved immediately, so you can temporarily implement coexistence to help facilitate a faster migration to the latest product version.

segment.source: Using Office coexistence on a long-term basis is never recommended, and your organization should have a plan to fully transition in the immediate future.
segment.target: Using Office coexistence on a long-term basis is never recommended, and your organization should have a plan to fully transition in the immediate future.

segment.source: Before implementing Office coexistence, review the following Office documentation.
segment.target: Before implementing Office coexistence, review the following Office documentation.

segment.source: Choose the article that corresponds to the newest version of Office for which you plan to implement coexistence.
segment.target: Choose the article that corresponds to the newest version of Office for which you plan to implement coexistence.

segment.source: Information about how to use Office 2013 suites and programs (MSI deployment) on a computer that is running another version of Office
segment.target: Information about how to use Office 2013 suites and programs (MSI deployment) on a computer that is running another version of Office

segment.source: Information about how to use Office 2010 suites and programs on a computer that is running another version of Office
segment.target: Information about how to use Office 2010 suites and programs on a computer that is running another version of Office

segment.source: The Office documentation provides extensive guidance on coexistence for Windows Installer-based (MSi) and Click-to-Run installations of Office.
segment.target: The Office documentation provides extensive guidance on coexistence for Windows Installer-based (MSi) and Click-to-Run installations of Office.

segment.source: This App-V topic on coexistence supplements the Office guidance with information that is more specific to App-V deployments.
segment.target: This App-V topic on coexistence supplements the Office guidance with information that is more specific to App-V deployments.

segment.source: The following tables summarize the supported coexistence scenarios.
segment.target: The following tables summarize the supported coexistence scenarios.

segment.source: They are organized according to the version and deployment method you’re starting with and the version and deployment method you are migrating to.
segment.target: They are organized according to the version and deployment method you’re starting with and the version and deployment method you are migrating to.

segment.source: Be sure to fully test all coexistence solutions before deploying them to a production audience.
segment.target: Be sure to fully test all coexistence solutions before deploying them to a production audience.

segment.source: Microsoft does not support the use of multiple versions of Office in Windows Server environments that have the Remote Desktop Session Host role service enabled.
segment.target: Microsoft does not support the use of multiple versions of Office in Windows Server environments that have the Remote Desktop Session Host role service enabled.

segment.source: To run Office coexistence scenarios, you must disable this role service.
segment.target: To run Office coexistence scenarios, you must disable this role service.

segment.source: The Windows Installer-based and Click-to-Run Office installation methods integrate with certain points of the underlying Windows operating system.
segment.target: The Windows Installer-based and Click-to-Run Office installation methods integrate with certain points of the underlying Windows operating system.

segment.source: When you use coexistence, common operating system integrations between two Office versions can conflict, causing compatibility and user experience issues.
segment.target: When you use coexistence, common operating system integrations between two Office versions can conflict, causing compatibility and user experience issues.

segment.source: With App-V, you can sequence certain versions of Office to exclude integrations, thereby “isolating” them from the operating system.
segment.target: With App-V, you can sequence certain versions of Office to exclude integrations, thereby “isolating” them from the operating system.

segment.source: Mode in which App-V can sequence this version of Office
segment.target: Mode in which App-V can sequence this version of Office

segment.source: App-V does not offer any operating system integrations with a virtualized version of Office 2007.
segment.target: App-V does not offer any operating system integrations with a virtualized version of Office 2007.

segment.source: Windows operating system integrations cannot be disabled.
segment.target: Windows operating system integrations cannot be disabled.

segment.source: Microsoft recommends that you deploy Office coexistence with only one integrated Office instance.
segment.target: Microsoft recommends that you deploy Office coexistence with only one integrated Office instance.

segment.source: For example, if you’re using App-V to deploy Office 2010 and Office 2013, you should sequence Office 2010 in non-integrated mode.
segment.target: For example, if you’re using App-V to deploy Office 2010 and Office 2013, you should sequence Office 2010 in non-integrated mode.

segment.source: For more information about sequencing Office in non-integration (isolated) mode, see How to sequence Microsoft Office 2010 in Microsoft Application Virtualization 5.0.
segment.target: For more information about sequencing Office in non-integration (isolated) mode, see How to sequence Microsoft Office 2010 in Microsoft Application Virtualization 5.0.

segment.source: Known limitations of Office coexistence scenarios
segment.target: Known limitations of Office coexistence scenarios

segment.source: The following sections describe some issues that you might encounter when using App-V to implement coexistence with Office.
segment.target: The following sections describe some issues that you might encounter when using App-V to implement coexistence with Office.

segment.source: Limitations common to Windows Installer-based/Click-to-Run and App-V Office coexistence scenarios
segment.target: Limitations common to Windows Installer-based/Click-to-Run and App-V Office coexistence scenarios

segment.source: The following limitations can occur when you install the following versions of Office on the same computer:
segment.target: The following limitations can occur when you install the following versions of Office on the same computer:

segment.source: Office 2010 by using the Windows Installer-based version
segment.target: Office 2010 by using the Windows Installer-based version

segment.source: After you publish Office 2013 by using App-V side by side with an earlier version of the Windows Installer-based Office 2010 might also cause the Windows Installer to start.
segment.target: After you publish Office 2013 by using App-V side by side with an earlier version of the Windows Installer-based Office 2010 might also cause the Windows Installer to start.

segment.source: This is because the Windows Installer-based or Click-to-Run version of Office 2010 is trying to automatically register itself to the computer.
segment.target: This is because the Windows Installer-based or Click-to-Run version of Office 2010 is trying to automatically register itself to the computer.

segment.source: To bypass the auto-registration operation for native Word 2010, follow these steps:
segment.target: To bypass the auto-registration operation for native Word 2010, follow these steps:

segment.source: Start the Registry Editor by doing the following:
segment.target: Start the Registry Editor by doing the following:

segment.source: In Windows 7: Click Start, type regedit in the Start Search box, and then press Enter.
segment.target: In Windows 7: Click Start, type regedit in the Start Search box, and then press Enter.

segment.source: In Windows 8.1 or Windows 10, type regedit press Enter on the Start page and then press Enter.
segment.target: In Windows 8.1 or Windows 10, type regedit press Enter on the Start page and then press Enter.

segment.source: If you are prompted for an administrator password or for a confirmation, type the password, or click Continue.
segment.target: If you are prompted for an administrator password or for a confirmation, type the password, or click Continue.

segment.source: Locate and then select the following registry subkey:
segment.target: Locate and then select the following registry subkey:

segment.source: On the Edit menu, click New, and then click DWORD Value.
segment.target: On the Edit menu, click New, and then click DWORD Value.

segment.source: Type NoReReg, and then press Enter.
segment.target: Type NoReReg, and then press Enter.

segment.source: Right-click NoReReg and then click Modify.
segment.target: Right-click NoReReg and then click Modify.

segment.source: In the Valuedata box, type 1, and then click OK.
segment.target: In the Valuedata box, type 1, and then click OK.

segment.source: On the File menu, click Exit to close Registry Editor.
segment.target: On the File menu, click Exit to close Registry Editor.

segment.source: How Office integrates with Windows when you use App-V to deploy Office
segment.target: How Office integrates with Windows when you use App-V to deploy Office

segment.source: When you deploy Office 2013 by using App-V, Office is fully integrated with the operating system, which provides end users with the same features and functionality as Office has when it is deployed without App-V.
segment.target: When you deploy Office 2013 by using App-V, Office is fully integrated with the operating system, which provides end users with the same features and functionality as Office has when it is deployed without App-V.

segment.source: The Office 2013 App-V package supports the following integration points with the Windows operating system:
segment.target: The Office 2013 App-V package supports the following integration points with the Windows operating system:

segment.source: Lync meeting Join Plug-in for Firefox and Chrome
segment.target: Lync meeting Join Plug-in for Firefox and Chrome

segment.source: User can join Lync meetings from Firefox and Chrome
segment.target: User can join Lync meetings from Firefox and Chrome

segment.source: Send to OneNote Internet Explorer Add-In
segment.target: Send to OneNote Internet Explorer Add-In

segment.source: User can send to OneNote from IE
segment.target: User can send to OneNote from IE

segment.source: Firewall Exception for Lync and Outlook
segment.target: Firewall Exception for Lync and Outlook

segment.source: Firewall Exception for Lync and Outlook
segment.target: Firewall Exception for Lync and Outlook

segment.source: Native apps and add-ins can interact with virtual Outlook through MAPI
segment.target: Native apps and add-ins can interact with virtual Outlook through MAPI

segment.source: User can use SharePoint features in Firefox
segment.target: User can use SharePoint features in Firefox

segment.source: User gets the mail control panel applet in Outlook
segment.target: User gets the mail control panel applet in Outlook

segment.source: Allows Document Cache for Office applications
segment.target: Allows Document Cache for Office applications

segment.source: For more information on ActiveX controls, refer to ActiveX Control API Reference.
segment.target: For more information on ActiveX controls, refer to ActiveX Control API Reference.

segment.source: Windows Explorer shell icon overlays when users look at folders OneDrive Pro folders
segment.target: Windows Explorer shell icon overlays when users look at folders OneDrive Pro folders

segment.target: For App-V issues, use the App-V TechNet Forum.
